roleset.name: to supply with power

example.name: power-v: passive
example.text: The announcements are scheduled to be made in Temple , Texas , and include a so-called `` notebook '' PC that weighs less than seven pounds , has a built - in hard disk drive and is powered by Intel Corp. 's 286 microprocessor .

example.name: power-v: with Arg2
example.text: Stewart & Stevenson makes equipment powered with diesel and gas turbines .

example.name: power-v: transitive
example.text: The company 's lean operation , analysts said , allowed sharp - rising sales from its cholesterol drug , Lopid , to power earnings growth .

propbank.arg: sharp - rising sales from its cholesterol drug , Lopid

roleset.note: POWER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'power' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from power.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: having great power, influence

role.descr: what the power is used for-- secondary action

example.name: powerful-j: arg1-emotional power
example.text: The statement by this party secretary is so powerful

propbank.arg: The statement by this party secretary

example.name: powerful-j: both args
example.text: God 's Word is Powerful to Accomplish all His Purposes .

example.name: powerful-j: concatenation of arg1
example.text: The video they created simulating an active shooter in a school is powerful to watch .

propbank.arg: The video they created simulating an active shooter in a school
